titles.title: Presidential Records Preservation Act
To amend title 44, United States Code, to require the President make and preserve records, and for other purposes.
Presidential Records Preservation Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

term.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

bill.summary:
Presidential Records Preservation Act
This bill directs the President to make and preserve records containing adequate and proper documentation of' presidential activities, deliberations, decisions, and policies, including establishing records management controls to capture, manage, and preserve electronic messages and ensure that such messages are readily accessible for retrieval through electronic searches.
